1.verse: The Family History of Jesus - This is the ·family history [record of the ancestors; genealogy; book of the offspring/family; perhaps a title for the entire book] of Jesus ·Christ [the Messiah]. ·He came from the family of David, and David came from the family of Abraham […the son of David, the son of Abraham; “son” can mean descendant].

2.verse: Abraham ·was the father of [fathered; begot; and so throughout the genealogy; the word can refer to more distant ancestry] Isaac. Isaac was the father of Jacob. Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers.

3.verse: Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah. (Their mother was Tamar [Gen. 38].) Perez was the father of Hezron. Hezron was the father of Ram.

4.verse: Ram was the father of Amminadab. Amminadab was the father of Nahshon. Nahshon was the father of Salmon.

5.verse: Salmon was the father of Boaz. (Boaz’s mother was Rahab [Josh. 2].) Boaz was the father of Obed. (Obed’s mother was Ruth [Ruth 4:13–22].) Obed was the father of Jesse.

6.verse: Jesse was the father of King David. David was the father of Solomon. (Solomon’s mother had been Uriah’s wife [Bathsheba; 2 Sam. 11—12].)

7.verse: Solomon was the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam was the father of Abijah. Abijah was the father of Asa.

8.verse: Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat was the father of Joram [a variant spelling of Jehoram; 1 Kin. 22:50]. Joram was the ·ancestor [or father; see v. 2] of Uzziah.

9.verse: Uzziah was the father of Jotham. Jotham was the father of Ahaz. Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah.

10.verse: Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh. Manasseh was the father of Amon. Amon was the father of Josiah.

11.verse: Josiah was the ·grandfather [or father; see v. 2] of Jeconiah [another name for Jehoiachin; see 2 Kin. 24:6; 1 Chr. 3:16] and his brothers. (This was at the time ·that the people were taken [of the exile/deportation; 2 Kin. 24:8–17] to Babylon.)

12.verse: After ·they were taken [the exile/deportation] to Babylon: Jeconiah was the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel was the ·grandfather [or father; see v. 2] of Zerubbabel [Ezra 2].

13.verse: Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud. Abiud was the father of Eliakim. Eliakim was the father of Azor.

14.verse: Azor was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of ·Akim [Achim]. ·Akim [Achim] was the father of Eliud.

15.verse: Eliud was the father of Eleazar. Eleazar was the father of Matthan. Matthan was the father of Jacob.

16.verse: Jacob was the father of Joseph. Joseph was the husband of Mary, and Mary ·was the mother of [gave birth to] Jesus, who is called the ·Christ [Messiah].

17.verse: So there were fourteen generations [in all] from Abraham to David. And there were fourteen generations from David until the ·people were taken [exile; deportation] to Babylon. And there were fourteen generations from the time ·when the people were taken [of the exile/deportation] to Babylon until ·Christ [the Messiah] was born.

63.verse: They said, “Sir, we remember that while that ·liar [deceiver; impostor] was still alive he said, ‘After three days I will rise from the dead.’

64.verse: So give the order for the tomb to be ·guarded closely [secured; sealed] till the third day. Otherwise, his ·followers [disciples] might come and steal the body and tell people that he has risen from the dead. ·That lie [The last deception] would be even worse than the first one.”

65.verse: Pilate said, “·Take some soldiers [or You have a guard; the phrase could mean Pilate sends Roman soldiers or that the leaders should use their own temple police] and go ·guard [secure] the tomb the best way you know.”

66.verse: So they all went to the tomb and ·made it safe from thieves [secured it] ·by sealing [or by placing a wax seal on] the stone in the entrance and putting soldiers there to guard it.

1.verse: Jesus Rises from the Dead - After the Sabbath day, at dawn on the first day the week, Mary Magdalene and ·another woman named Mary [the other Mary; 27:56] went to look at the tomb.

2.verse: ·At that time [Suddenly; And behold] there was a strong earthquake. [For] An angel of the Lord came down from heaven, went to the tomb, and rolled the stone away from the entrance. Then he sat on the stone.

3.verse: ·He was shining as bright as [His appearance was like] lightning, and his clothes were white as snow.

4.verse: The soldiers guarding the tomb shook with fear because of the angel, and they ·became like dead men [perhaps they were paralyzed by fear, or they fainted].

5.verse: The angel said to the women, “Don’t be afraid. I know that you are looking for Jesus, who has been crucified.

6.verse: He is not here. He has ·risen [been raised] from the dead as he said he would. Come and see the place where ·his body was [he lay].

7.verse: And go quickly and tell his ·followers [disciples], ‘Jesus has risen from the dead. He is going into Galilee ahead of you, and you will see him there.’” Then the angel said, “·Now [Look; Behold] I have told you.”

8.verse: The women left the tomb quickly. They were afraid, but they were also ·very happy [filled with great joy]. They ran to tell Jesus’ ·followers [disciples] what had happened.

9.verse: ·Suddenly [And look/behold], Jesus met them and said, “Greetings.” The women came up to him, ·took hold of [clasped] his feet, and worshiped him.

10.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t be afraid. Go and tell my ·followers [disciples] to go on to Galilee, and they will see me there.”

11.verse: The Soldiers Report to the Leaders - While the women ·went to tell Jesus’ followers [were on their way], some of the soldiers who had been guarding the tomb went into the city to tell the ·leading [chief] priests everything that had happened.

12.verse: Then the priests met with the elders and made a plan. They paid the soldiers a ·large amount of money [substantial bribe]

13.verse: and said to them, “Tell the people that Jesus’ ·followers [disciples] came during the night and stole ·the body [him away] while you were asleep.

14.verse: If the governor hears about this, we will satisfy him and save you from trouble.”

15.verse: So the soldiers kept the money and did as they were ·told [instructed]. And that story is still spread among the ·people [Jews] even ·today [to this day].

16.verse: Jesus Talks to His Followers - The eleven ·followers [disciples] went to Galilee to the mountain where Jesus had ·told [designated; arranged for] them to go.

17.verse: When they saw Jesus, they worshiped him, but some of them ·did not believe it was really Jesus [doubted].

18.verse: Then Jesus came to them and said, “All ·power [authority] in heaven and on earth ·is [has been] given to me.

19.verse: So go and make ·followers [disciples] of all ·people in the world [the nations]. Baptize them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

20.verse: Teach them to obey everything that I have ·taught [commanded] you, and I will be with you always, even until the end of ·this age [the world; time].
